text:
when you try to test sites that maintain session ,in JMeter HTTPSampler the 
session is not maintained.
creator: chezhiyan@siptech.co.in
chezhiyan@siptech.co.in
text:
Sorry, the bug description wasn't clear enough.

JMeter doesn't support session maintanance while proxy recording. It does not
record the cookies which the browser sends to the server. User has to manually
add all these cookies. Moreover since cookie manager doesn't support regular
expressions, there's no way JMeter can send back the same values of cookies
which the server sends to the client side.

creator: mstover1@apache.org
text:
It doesn't record cookies because 99 times in 100 cookies are for maintaining
session state.  Recording such cookies would be useless because they are
different for every session.  JMeter's cookie manager does not need you to enter
such cookies in manually - it tracks them automatically, and yes it does send
back the same values to the server that the server sent to the client.  If you
have further questions about this, ask on the list please.
